verses.roman:
ya enaṁ śrāvayen martya
uttamaḥ-śloka-vikramam
samāhito vā śṛṇuyāt
sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate

synonyms: yaḥ—one who; enam—this; śrāvayet—causes others to hear; martyaḥ—a mortal human; uttamaḥ-śloka—of Lord Kṛṣṇa, who is praised in the best transcendental verses; vikramam—the heroic pastime; samāhitaḥ—with concentration; vā—or; śṛṇuyāt—hears; sarva—from all; pāpaiḥ—sins; pramucyate—becomes released.
translation: Any mortal who recounts this heroic pastime of Lord Uttamaḥ-śloka's, or who simply hears it attentively, will become freed from all sins.
